description:
The global namespace of features contained in an analysis.

Top-level members are unnamespaced, everything else is contained
in a namespace. Often an analysis will contain only one namespace at
the root.

___name.description: The name of the attribute. e.g. `value`, `icon`, `should-collapse`.

___inheritedFrom.description: The identifier of the class or mixin that declared this property.

___description.description: A markdown description for the attribute.

___type.description:
The type that the attribute will be serialized/deserialized as.

e.g. `string`, `number`, `boolean`, `RegExp`, `Array`, `Object`.

___file.description:
Path to the file containing the definition of the feature,
relative to the parent feature, or the package if the feature has no parent
(e.g. elements).

If blank, the feature is defined in the same file as its parent.

___sourceRange.description: Where this feature is defined in source code.

___defaultValue.description:
The default value of the attribute, if any.

As attributes are always strings, this is the actual value, not a human
readable description.

___metadata.description:
An extension point for framework-specific metadata, as well as any
metadata not yet standardized here such as what polyfills are needed,
behaviors and mixins used, the framework that the element was written in,
tags/categories, links to specs that the element implements, etc.

Framework-specific metadata should be put into a sub-object with the name
of that framework.

___name.description: The name of the event.

___inheritedFrom.description: The identifier of the class or mixin that declared this property.

___description.description: A markdown description of the event.

___type.description:
The type of the event object that's fired.

e.g. `Event`, `CustomEvent`, `KeyboardEvent`, `MyCustomEvent`.

___file.description:
Path to the file containing the definition of the feature,
relative to the parent feature, or the package if the feature has no parent
(e.g. elements).

If blank, the feature is defined in the same file as its parent.

___sourceRange.description: Where this feature is defined in source code.

___detail.description: Information about the `detail` field of the event.

___name.description: The name of the property. e.g. `value`, `icon`, `shouldCollapse`.

___inheritedFrom.description: The identifier of the class or mixin that declared this property.

___description.description: A markdown description of the property.

___type.description:
The javascript type of the property.

There's no standard here. Common choices are closure compiler syntax
and typescript syntax.

___properties.description: Nested subproperties hanging off of this property.

___sourceRange.description: Where this feature is defined in source code.

___defaultValue.description:
A string representation of the default value. Intended only to be human
readable, so may be a description, an identifier name, etc.

___metadata.description:
An extension point for framework-specific metadata, as well as any
metadata not yet standardized here such as what polyfills are needed,
behaviors and mixins used, the framework that the element was written in,
tags/categories, links to specs that the element implements, etc.

Framework-specific metadata should be put into a sub-object with the name
of that framework.

An extension point for framework-specific metadata, as well as any
metadata not yet standardized here such as what polyfills are needed,
behaviors and mixins used, the framework that the element was written in,
tags/categories, links to specs that the element implements, etc.

Framework-specific metadata should be put into a sub-object with the name
of that framework.

___properties.description: The properties that this feature has.

___superclass.description: The class, if any, that this class extends.

___sourceRange.description: Where this feature is defined in source code.

___name.description: The name of the class.

___description.description: A markdown description.

___methods.description: The instance methods that this feature has.

___staticMethods.description: The static, class-level methods that this feature has.

___demos.description:
Paths, relative to the base directory of the package, to demo pages for
this feauture.

e.g. `[{url: 'demos/index.html', description: 'How it works'}, ...]`

___path.description:
The path, relative to the base directory of the package.

e.g. `paper-input.html` or `app-toolbar/app-toolbar.html` (given that
app-toolbar lives in the app-layout package).

___metadata.description:
An extension point for framework-specific metadata, as well as any
metadata not yet standardized here such as what polyfills are needed,
behaviors and mixins used, the framework that the element was written in,
tags/categories, links to specs that the element implements, etc.

Framework-specific metadata should be put into a sub-object with the name
of that framework.

___name.description: The globally accessible property-path of the namespace. e.q. `Polymer.dom`

___description.description: A markdown description for the namespace.

___attributes.description: The attributes that this element is known to understand.

___properties.description: The properties that this feature has.

___superclass.description:
The class that this element extends.

This is non-optional, as every custom element must have HTMLElement in
its prototype change.

e.g. `HTMLElement`, `HTMLInputElement`, `MyNamespace.MyBaseElement`

___tagname.description: The tagname that the element registers itself as. e.g. `paper-input`

___sourceRange.description: Where this feature is defined in source code.

___name.description:
The class name for this element.

e.g. `MyElement`, `Polymer.PaperInput`

___description.description: A markdown description.

___events.description: The events that this element fires.

___slots.description: The shadow dom content slots that this element accepts.

___extends.description:
The tagname that the element extends, if any. The value of the `extends`
option that's passed into `customElements.define`.

e.g. `input`, `paper-button`, `my-super-element`

___methods.description: The instance methods that this feature has.

___staticMethods.description: The static, class-level methods that this feature has.

___demos.description:
Paths, relative to the base directory of the package, to demo pages for
this feauture.

e.g. `[{url: 'demos/index.html', description: 'How it works'}, ...]`

___path.description:
The path, relative to the base directory of the package.

e.g. `paper-input.html` or `app-toolbar/app-toolbar.html` (given that
app-toolbar lives in the app-layout package).

___styling.description: Information useful for styling the element and its children.

___selectors.description: CSS selectors that the element recognizes on itself for styling.

___description.description:
A markdown description of the effect of this selector matching
on the element.

___needsExplicitSize.description: If true, the element must be given an explicit size by its context.

___cssVariables.description: CSS Variables that the element understands.

___fallbackBehavior.description:
A markdown description of how the element will fallback if the variable
isn't defined.

___name.description: The name of the variable. e.g. `--header-color`, `--my-element-size`

___description.description: A markdown description of the variable.

___type.description: The type of the variable. Advisory. e.g. `color`, `size`

___metadata.description:
An extension point for framework-specific metadata, as well as any
metadata not yet standardized here such as what polyfills are needed,
behaviors and mixins used, the framework that the element was written in,
tags/categories, links to specs that the element implements, etc.

Framework-specific metadata should be put into a sub-object with the name
of that framework.

___attributes.description: The attributes that this element is known to understand.

___properties.description: The properties that this feature has.

___superclass.description: The class, if any, that this class extends.

___sourceRange.description: Where this feature is defined in source code.

___name.description:
The name for this mixin.

e.g. `MyMixin`, `Polymer.PaperInputMixin`

___description.description: A markdown description.

___events.description: The events that this element fires.

___slots.description: The shadow dom content slots that this element accepts.

___methods.description: The instance methods that this feature has.

___staticMethods.description: The static, class-level methods that this feature has.

___demos.description:

this feauture.

e.g. `[{url: 'demos/index.html', description: 'How it works'}, ...]`

___path.description:

app-toolbar lives in the app-layout package).

___selectors.description: CSS selectors that the element recognizes on itself for styling.

___fallbackBehavior.description:

___name.description: The name of the variable. e.g. `--header-color`, `--my-element-size`

___metadata.description:
An extension point for framework-specific metadata, as well as any
metadata not yet standardized here such as what polyfills are needed,
behaviors and mixins used, the framework that the element was written in,
tags/categories, links to specs that the element implements, etc.

Framework-specific metadata should be put into a sub-object with the name
of that framework.

___sourceRange.description: Where this feature is defined in source code.

___methods.description: The instance methods that this feature has.

___name.description: The name of the property. e.g. `value`, `icon`, `shouldCollapse`.

___inheritedFrom.description: The identifier of the class or mixin that declared this property.

___description.description: A markdown description of the property.

___params.description:
An array of data objects describing the method signature. This data may be
incomplete. For example, only argument names can be detected from an
undocumented JavaScript function. Argument types can only be read from
associated JSDoc via @param tags

___return.description:
Data describing the method return type. This data may be incomplete.
For example, the return type can be detected from a documented JavaScript
function with associated JSDoc and a @return tag.

___sourceRange.description: Where this feature is defined in source code.

___metadata.description:
An extension point for framework-specific metadata, as well as any
metadata not yet standardized here such as what polyfills are needed,
behaviors and mixins used, the framework that the element was written in,
tags/categories, links to specs that the element implements, etc.

Framework-specific metadata should be put into a sub-object with the name
of that framework.

___column.description: Column offset within the line, starting from zero.

___attributes.description: The attributes that this element is known to understand.

___name.description: The name of the attribute. e.g. `value`, `icon`, `should-collapse`.

___inheritedFrom.description: The identifier of the class or mixin that declared this property.

___description.description: A markdown description for the attribute.

___type.description:
The type that the attribute will be serialized/deserialized as.

e.g. `string`, `number`, `boolean`, `RegExp`, `Array`, `Object`.

___sourceRange.description: Where this feature is defined in source code.

___defaultValue.description:
The default value of the attribute, if any.

As attributes are always strings, this is the actual value, not a human
readable description.

___metadata.description:
An extension point for framework-specific metadata, as well as any
metadata not yet standardized here such as what polyfills are needed,
behaviors and mixins used, the framework that the element was written in,
tags/categories, links to specs that the element implements, etc.

Framework-specific metadata should be put into a sub-object with the name
of that framework.

___properties.description: The properties that this feature has.

___name.description: The name of the property. e.g. `value`, `icon`, `shouldCollapse`.

___inheritedFrom.description: The identifier of the class or mixin that declared this property.

___description.description: A markdown description of the property.

___type.description:
The javascript type of the property.

There's no standard here. Common choices are closure compiler syntax
and typescript syntax.

___properties.description: Nested subproperties hanging off of this property.

___sourceRange.description: Where this feature is defined in source code.

___defaultValue.description:
A string representation of the default value. Intended only to be human
readable, so may be a description, an identifier name, etc.

___metadata.description:
An extension point for framework-specific metadata, as well as any
metadata not yet standardized here such as what polyfills are needed,
behaviors and mixins used, the framework that the element was written in,
tags/categories, links to specs that the element implements, etc.

Framework-specific metadata should be put into a sub-object with the name
of that framework.

___superclass.description: The class, if any, that this class extends.

___file.description:
Path to the file containing the definition of the feature,
relative to the parent feature, or the package if the feature has no parent
(e.g. elements).

If blank, the feature is defined in the same file as its parent.

___sourceRange.description: Where this feature is defined in source code.

___name.description:
The name for this mixin.

e.g. `MyMixin`, `Polymer.PaperInputMixin`

___description.description: A markdown description.

___events.description: The events that this element fires.

___name.description: The name of the event.

___inheritedFrom.description: The identifier of the class or mixin that declared this property.

___description.description: A markdown description of the event.

___type.description:
The type of the event object that's fired.

e.g. `Event`, `CustomEvent`, `KeyboardEvent`, `MyCustomEvent`.

___sourceRange.description: Where this feature is defined in source code.

___detail.description: Information about the `detail` field of the event.

___metadata.description:
An extension point for framework-specific metadata, as well as any
metadata not yet standardized here such as what polyfills are needed,
behaviors and mixins used, the framework that the element was written in,
tags/categories, links to specs that the element implements, etc.

Framework-specific metadata should be put into a sub-object with the name
of that framework.

___slots.description: The shadow dom content slots that this element accepts.

___name.description: The name of the slot. e.g. `banner`, `body`, `tooltipContents`

___description.description: A markdown description of the slot.

___sourceRange.description: Where this feature is defined in source code.

___metadata.description:
An extension point for framework-specific metadata, as well as any
metadata not yet standardized here such as what polyfills are needed,
behaviors and mixins used, the framework that the element was written in,
tags/categories, links to specs that the element implements, etc.

Framework-specific metadata should be put into a sub-object with the name
of that framework.

___methods.description: The instance methods that this feature has.

___name.description: The name of the property. e.g. `value`, `icon`, `shouldCollapse`.

___inheritedFrom.description: The identifier of the class or mixin that declared this property.

___description.description: A markdown description of the property.

___params.description:
An array of data objects describing the method signature. This data may be
incomplete. For example, only argument names can be detected from an
undocumented JavaScript function. Argument types can only be read from
associated JSDoc via @param tags

___return.description:
Data describing the method return type. This data may be incomplete.
For example, the return type can be detected from a documented JavaScript
function with associated JSDoc and a @return tag.

___sourceRange.description: Where this feature is defined in source code.

___metadata.description:
An extension point for framework-specific metadata, as well as any
metadata not yet standardized here such as what polyfills are needed,
behaviors and mixins used, the framework that the element was written in,
tags/categories, links to specs that the element implements, etc.

Framework-specific metadata should be put into a sub-object with the name
of that framework.

___staticMethods.description: The static, class-level methods that this feature has.

___name.description: The name of the property. e.g. `value`, `icon`, `shouldCollapse`.

___inheritedFrom.description: The identifier of the class or mixin that declared this property.

___description.description: A markdown description of the property.

___params.description:
An array of data objects describing the method signature. This data may be
incomplete. For example, only argument names can be detected from an
undocumented JavaScript function. Argument types can only be read from
associated JSDoc via @param tags

___return.description:
Data describing the method return type. This data may be incomplete.
For example, the return type can be detected from a documented JavaScript
function with associated JSDoc and a @return tag.

___sourceRange.description: Where this feature is defined in source code.

___metadata.description:
An extension point for framework-specific metadata, as well as any
metadata not yet standardized here such as what polyfills are needed,
behaviors and mixins used, the framework that the element was written in,
tags/categories, links to specs that the element implements, etc.

Framework-specific metadata should be put into a sub-object with the name
of that framework.

___demos.description:
Paths, relative to the base directory of the package, to demo pages for
this feauture.

e.g. `[{url: 'demos/index.html', description: 'How it works'}, ...]`

___description.description: A markdown description of the demo.

___path.description:
The path, relative to the base directory of the package.

e.g. `paper-input.html` or `app-toolbar/app-toolbar.html` (given that
app-toolbar lives in the app-layout package).

___styling.description: Information useful for styling the element and its children.

___selectors.description: CSS selectors that the element recognizes on itself for styling.

___description.description:
A markdown description of the effect of this selector matching
on the element.

___needsExplicitSize.description: If true, the element must be given an explicit size by its context.

___cssVariables.description: CSS Variables that the element understands.

___fallbackBehavior.description:
A markdown description of how the element will fallback if the variable
isn't defined.

___name.description: The name of the variable. e.g. `--header-color`, `--my-element-size`

___description.description: A markdown description of the variable.

___type.description: The type of the variable. Advisory. e.g. `color`, `size`

___metadata.description:
An extension point for framework-specific metadata, as well as any
metadata not yet standardized here such as what polyfills are needed,
behaviors and mixins used, the framework that the element was written in,
tags/categories, links to specs that the element implements, etc.

Framework-specific metadata should be put into a sub-object with the name
of that framework.

___classes.description:
All toplevel classes found that were not covered by one of the other types.

e.g. classes that are elements are only found in `elements`

___properties.description: The properties that this feature has.

___superclass.description: The class, if any, that this class extends.

___sourceRange.description: Where this feature is defined in source code.

___name.description: The name of the class.

___description.description: A markdown description.

___methods.description: The instance methods that this feature has.

___staticMethods.description: The static, class-level methods that this feature has.

___demos.description:
Paths, relative to the base directory of the package, to demo pages for
this feauture.

e.g. `[{url: 'demos/index.html', description: 'How it works'}, ...]`

___path.description:
The path, relative to the base directory of the package.

e.g. `paper-input.html` or `app-toolbar/app-toolbar.html` (given that
app-toolbar lives in the app-layout package).

___metadata.description:
An extension point for framework-specific metadata, as well as any
metadata not yet standardized here such as what polyfills are needed,
behaviors and mixins used, the framework that the element was written in,
tags/categories, links to specs that the element implements, etc.

Framework-specific metadata should be put into a sub-object with the name
of that framework.

___attributes.description: The attributes that this element is known to understand.

___properties.description: The properties that this feature has.

___superclass.description:
The class that this element extends.

This is non-optional, as every custom element must have HTMLElement in
its prototype change.

e.g. `HTMLElement`, `HTMLInputElement`, `MyNamespace.MyBaseElement`

___tagname.description: The tagname that the element registers itself as. e.g. `paper-input`

___sourceRange.description: Where this feature is defined in source code.

___name.description:
The class name for this element.

e.g. `MyElement`, `Polymer.PaperInput`

___description.description: A markdown description.

___events.description: The events that this element fires.

___slots.description: The shadow dom content slots that this element accepts.

___extends.description:
The tagname that the element extends, if any. The value of the `extends`
option that's passed into `customElements.define`.

e.g. `input`, `paper-button`, `my-super-element`

___methods.description: The instance methods that this feature has.

___staticMethods.description: The static, class-level methods that this feature has.

___demos.description:
Paths, relative to the base directory of the package, to demo pages for
this feauture.

e.g. `[{url: 'demos/index.html', description: 'How it works'}, ...]`

___path.description:
The path, relative to the base directory of the package.

e.g. `paper-input.html` or `app-toolbar/app-toolbar.html` (given that
app-toolbar lives in the app-layout package).

___styling.description: Information useful for styling the element and its children.

___selectors.description: CSS selectors that the element recognizes on itself for styling.

___description.description:
A markdown description of the effect of this selector matching
on the element.

___needsExplicitSize.description: If true, the element must be given an explicit size by its context.

___cssVariables.description: CSS Variables that the element understands.

___fallbackBehavior.description:
A markdown description of how the element will fallback if the variable
isn't defined.

___name.description: The name of the variable. e.g. `--header-color`, `--my-element-size`

___description.description: A markdown description of the variable.

___type.description: The type of the variable. Advisory. e.g. `color`, `size`

An extension point for framework-specific metadata, as well as any

___name.description: The globally accessible property-path of the namespace. e.q. `Polymer.dom`

___description.description: A markdown description for the namespace.

___summary.description: A markdown summary for the namespace.

___sourceRange.description: Where this feature is defined in source code.

An extension point for framework-specific metadata, as well as any
metadata not yet standardized here such as what polyfills are needed,

An extension point for framework-specific metadata, as well as any
metadata not yet standardized here such as what polyfills are needed,
behaviors and mixins used, the framework that the package was written in,
tags/categories, framework config files, etc.

Framework-specific metadata should be put into a sub-object with the name
of that framework.
